SecretMtyh, you kick ass! Thanks for all your hard work. All your movies look so damn good!

I stream them on my xbox360. The only problem is I have a Mac and we don't have any way to convert the files to 2channel audio if the movie is larger than 2GB. I know for PC everyone uses YAMB. We don't have such a program for Mac. I convert them to 2channel audio in Terminal using MP4Box (Mac), but the file size limit is 2GB. I can't convert your movies that are larger than 2GB. So unfortunately I miss out on your great work if it's larger than 2GB. I wish we (Mac) had a way to convert files larger than 2GB. Anyone know a way?

Thanks again for all your amazing hard work!!!

Keep it up!

Very nice video and audio, unfortunately they're horribly out of sync. Same result in both VLC and Media Player Classic.
About -3600ms audio time shift if you use Media Player Classic.

I actually reprocess the movie with ConvertXtoDVD 4 or 3 to DVD files and then use DVD Shrink 3.2 to re-aurther it (getting rid of the menues) and shrink to SL Disc. Fantastic picture and 5.1 Surround sound! I did not notice any out of sync sound when I watched. Anyway thanks again for the upload!!!
Looking forward to see it! :-) Thanks for uploading!

It works-looks and sounds fine on my computer, but when trying to stream it from my mac to my xbox360 with connect360 I get error code 69-C00D002F even though my xbox software is up to date.  This error code is allegedly because of constant bitrate audio instead of variable bitrate.  Anyone else run into this issue?
